text: when we don't get enough sleep it can
cause a number of negative health
outcomes in terms of our emotions not
getting enough sleep has been shown to
be a risk factor for depression in terms
of intellectually when we're deprived of
sleep it makes us harder for us to focus
and concentrate it can be a risk factor
for attention deficit hyperactivity
disorder or exacerbate the problem in
someone who has attention deficit
hyperactivity disorder and physically if
we're not getting enough sleep it can
result in insulin resistance which is a
risk factor for diabetes it will raise
our blood pressure when we sleep our
blood pressure dips so if we're not
sleeping as much then it's going to
raise our average 24-hour blood pressure
which creates extra pressure on our
cardiovascular system which over time
can lead to hypertrophic remodeling and
reset the entire cardiovascular system
to work at a higher level in lead to
hypertension it's also been shown to
increase levels of cholesterol so it
really does pay off to spend that extra
time in bed getting adequate sleep
